before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"nlg4","text":"This protocol is optimised for measuring an entire 96-well plate. It assumes that 16 wells will be used for measuring the standards and the blank samples (in duplicates) and 80 wells will be used for measuring unknown DNA samples (typically in duplicates).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97oc7","text":"The protocol can be easily adjusted for a lower number of samples by reducing the volume of the working solutions of the reagents. Note though that enough TE should be retained for diluting the standard stock solution (490 or 680 µl), for potentially diluting the unknown samples, if their concentration is too high, and for accounting for pipetting errors. To fill the plate, 19.2 ml of TE is needed. So if only 40 wells are to be used for measuring unknown samples prepare about   ml of TE buffer. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":481,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"13jvs","text":"The dynamic range of the assay is between 50 pg ml-1 to 1000 ng ml-1. This translates into DNA sample concentrations of 0.05-5 ng µl-1 and 1-200 ng µl-1 in the low-range and high-range assays, respectively. Samples with higher DNA concentration need to be diluted (e.g. in DNase-free water or TE buffer).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":50,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":66,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":132,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":150,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fpo6k","text":"Note that some compounds that can be present as DNA contaminations (e.g. salts, ethanol, detergents, proteins) are claimed by the manufacturer to not interfere with the measurement. Please refer to the full protocol for a list of these compounds and their effect on the measurement. Also, equimolar presence of ssDNA and RNA in the sample should have only minimal effect on the quantitation results. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ts98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"","data":{"formula":"50/96×22≈11.5","guid":"3AE75B2082DF11EA8183ADCA786DE722","id":0}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8aa59","text":"The following protocol is intended for the quantification of double-stranded DNA using Quant-iT™PicoGreen® dsDNA Assay Kit (ThermoFisher). This protocol is a simplified and condensed version of the full protocol from the manufacturer. The procedure described here is for 96 reactions. If samples are run in duplicates, then this should allow quantifying 40 samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":105,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":87,"length":49},{"key":1,"offset":198,"length":13}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5DCB0B9074B211EA8D5EB7C0B3B526E9","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/P7589?ICID=search-p7589#/P7589?ICID=search-p7589"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FBADF13D74B111EA914D0242AC110002","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/document-connect/document-connect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fassets.thermofisher.com%2FTFS-Assets%2FLSG%2Fmanuals%2Fmp07581.pdf\u0026title=UXVhbnQtaVQgUGljb0dyZWVuIGRzRE5BIFJlYWdlbnQgYW5kIEtpdHM="}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6fgd","text":"Take out all reagents from the fridge and bring them to room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"belgi","text":"Take out the DNA samples from the freezer. DNA samples should be slowly thawed on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"204qh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7bn9o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"e2dum","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"askb6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"b1s2r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3cvai","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"549mp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":18,"style":"sup"}],"key":"4l7ek","text":"Quant-iT™PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent is dissolved in dimethylsulfoxide (DMSO), which freezes below 19 °C. The reagent must be completely thawed before using it by bringing it to room temperature. After the reagent thawed, it is advisable to briefly vortex the tube to make sure it is adequately mixed and to spin it down in a centrifuge or a mini centrifuge.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":18,"style":"sup"}],"key":"127j5","text":"Quant-iT™PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent is light sensitive and should be protected from light at all times.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"","data":{"id":120104,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Quant-iT™ PicoGreen™ dsDNA Assay Kit","linfor":"","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/P11496","sku":"P11496","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"AB3A530074CF11EA8D5EB7C0B3B526E9","in_steps":null,"vendor":{"id":191,"name":"Invitrogen - Thermo Fisher","link":"http://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home/brands/invitrogen.html","image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"654vf","text":"Prepare 22 ml 1X TE buffer by pipetting 1.1 ml of 20X TE buffer into 20.9 ml of nuclease-free water into a sterile and nuclease-free 50 ml tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5eu9i","text":"Mix by inverting the tube several times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4u0","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"daaij","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1.1","guid":"6EF39236CFC1451E97DDAE14CAEF3678","id":"87440","label":"20X TE buffer","unit":1436}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20.9","error":false,"guid":"9D012846EA1244ECB14C3BDEDBC1764F","id":"87441","label":"nuclease-free water","unit":1436}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjg4o","text":"Plot the measured fluorescent values of the standard samples against their known concentrations and fit a linear curve using linear regression. Make sure that the coefficient of determination (R2) is close to 1 (typically \u003e 0.99). Calculate the DNA concentrations in the unknown samples using the slope and intercept parameters of the linear equation. Output values you obtained are in ng µl-1, assuming 1 µl of each sample was used.
